title: Pledging value when funds are low
vignette: Someone pledges to donate their full foundational document value but later cannot afford the assessed amount.

options.text: Allow a reduced payment based on means.
They must pay the full amount eventually.

title: Exchanging a promised for donation house
vignette: A man pledges his house to the central fund then wants to buy it back.

options.text: He may exchange it with an added fifth.
Once promised for donation, it cannot return to him.

title: Late payment of dedicated value
vignette: Years pass before the donor pays the assessment of worth for a promised for donation field.

options.text: Payment is accepted whenever it comes.
Delay nullifies the original pledge.

title: Assessment of Worth of an elderly person
vignette: A seventy-year-old pledges their value; the foundational document scale only goes up to sixty years old.

options.text: Use the highest category anyway.
Assess a lower amount given diminished strength.

title: Dedicated Property property used unintentionally
vignette: tools for special use are accidentally borrowed for mundane work.

options.text: Compensate for misuse with added fifth.
Return them with an apology; no fee.

title: Donating half of one's value
vignette: A person pledges to give half their assessment of worth instead of the full amount.

options.text: Half-payment suffices since that was stated.
Once mentioned, the full amount is binding.

title: Central Fund selling promised for donation homeland
vignette: homeland dedicated to the central assembly place is auctioned off to raise funds.

options.text: Allowed if proceeds support community religious activities.
Better to keep the homeland in central assembly place hands.

title: Valuing children under one month
vignette: Parents pledge the value of an infant less than thirty days old.

options.text: No fixed value; offer a voluntary gift instead.
Assign the lowest assessment of worth category.

title: Dedicated Property animal develops an imperfection
vignette: An animal dedicated for the offering place becomes lame before offering.

options.text: exchange it and offer another.
Offer it anyway despite the imperfection.

title: Using promised for donation items for collateral
vignette: Someone wants to secure a loan using utensils he already dedicated to the central assembly place.

options.text: Forbidden; they no longer belong to him.
Permitted temporarily if he repays quickly.

title: Partial Exchange of fields
vignette: Only a portion of a promised for donation field is exchanged; the rest remains special status.

options.text: Allowed by paying for the exchanged section.
All or nothing—exchange the entire field.

title: Valuing an enslaved person
vignette: An enslaved person pledges their own value to the central fund.

options.text: Accept payment according to the foundational document scale.
Their owner must pay instead.

title: Donating with intent to retract
vignette: A donor pledges property but secretly plans to annul it later.

options.text: The donation stands; intent doesn't void it.
Hidden intent cancels the pledge.

title: Central Fund financial manager misuses funds
vignette: A financial manager spends funds with special status on personal expenses by mistake.

options.text: He must repay with an added fifth.
If accidental, a simple apology suffices.

title: Assessment of Worth of women and men equalized
vignette: A proposal arises to set equal values for all genders in pledges.

options.text: Adopt equal assessments of worth for fairness.
Keep the foundational document's differentiated amounts.
